title.narrative: Ikere Ekiti Ogo-Oluwa Cassava Processing Project

description.narrative: The primary beneficiaries of the grant will be the 250 members of Ikere-Ekiti Ogo-Oluwa Cooperative Multipurpose Society. The monies will be used for training the members, procurement of farm inputs, purchase of farm machineries and processing equipment, construction of processing unit, purchase of coaster vehicle for transporting farm produce. The primary focus will be cassava production and processing. The cooperative plans to build their capacities on technical know-how of members agronomy practices and modernized method of cassava processing. They also intend to build their financial management and organizational capacities. The grant will lead to improved quality of the cooperative members cassava production and standard of living.

title.narrative: Construction of Electricity Smart Metering Assembly Plant in Nigeria

description.narrative: Our business concept activities is to setup a semi-knock down meter assembling factory in Nigeria and have all the parts of every one of meters produced in China by our partner Wasion and built into at least seven (7) modules for each meter. This will give us a very subsidized custom duty specifically for unfinished electricity meters, an incentive by the Nigerian government to encourage production and assembling of meters locally. They are shipped to our semi-knock down factory in Nigeria where the seven models of each meter are assembled as one meter, packaged, sold and installed to end-users who dont have electricity meters to improve access to affordable electricity.

title.narrative: Afao Ekiti Mechanized Cassava Farming and Processing

description.narrative: The primary beneficiaries of the grant will be the 130 members of Afao-Ekiti Ileriayo Cooperative Multipurpose Society. Although the applicant mentioned that increased activities through the grant will enable more people to join. The cooperative intends to expand their garri business and utilize the cassava waste into starch and feed production. The monies will be used for training, procurement of farm inputs, purchase of farm machineries and equipment, purchase of processing equipment and purchase of vehicle. The primary focus will be cassava production and processing. The cooperative plans to build their capacities in best agronomy practices on cassava cultivation and modernized method of cassava processing. They also intend to improve their financial management and organizational capacities. Similarly, they want to take an advantage of wider market opportunities through training on business development and quality control to enable them to export their product. The grant will improve the cooperative members standard of living.

title.narrative: Pure Souls Autism Capacity Building Project

description.narrative: Pure Souls Learning Foundation (PSLF or Foundation) was established and duly incorporated in Nigeria on January 4, 2005 under the companies and Allied Matters Act 1990, with registration number RC 614916. The Foundation has a four-member Board of Trustees and a five-member management team. The primary reasons for establishing the foundation are to provide support and care for children with autism; to create awareness of autistic disorders and their management; to organize seminars and forums on autistic disorders, care and management; and to provide scholarships for indigent autistic children., , Pure Souls Learning Foundation has plans to establish a skills acquisition center to train the adolescents in the Foundations school in their areas of strength, which include tailoring, and to equip them with skills to earn an income in the future. Internally displaced persons (IDPs) from the camps in Lagos will also be trained at the skills acquisition center and will subsequently be employed at the center to serve as trainers for the children. The Foundation, however, lacks the organizational and financial management capacity and needs additional resources and equipment to establish and operate the center effectively.,

description.narrative: Kagarko Dairy Producers Cooperative Society (KDPCS) is a registered cooperative society located in Maganda Village, a rural community in Kagarko Local Government Area of Kaduna State. The 279 members are low-income Fulani pastoralists engaged in dairy production. KDPCS sells raw milk to the Kaduna Federation of Milk Producers Cooperative Association (MILCOPAL), a milk processing organization in Northern Nigeria. MILCOPAL wants to buy more raw milk from KDPCS to meet local demand for processed milk, but KDPCS lacks the capacity to provide MILCOPAL enough raw milk. To capitalize on this market opportunity, KDPCS needs to improve on the quality and quantity of its milk, install better infrastructure and cooling system, procure more livestock and improve on its skills.

title.narrative: Kushe Milk Producers Enterprise Expansion Project

description.narrative: Kushe Milk Producers Cooperative Society (KMPCS) is a registered cooperative society located in Kushe Village, a rural community in Kagarko Local Government Area of Kaduna State. The 261 members are low-income Fulani pastoralists engaged in dairy production. KMPCS sells raw milk to the Kaduna Federation of Milk Producers Cooperative Association (MILCOPAL), a milk processing organization in Northern Nigeria. MILCOPAL wants to buy more raw milk from KMPCS to meet local demand for processed milk, but KMPCS lacks the capacity to provide MILCOPAL with enough raw milk. To capitalize on this market opportunity, KMPCS needs to improve on the quality and quantity of its milk, install better infrastructure and cooling system, procure more livestock and improve on its skills.

title.narrative: Special - She Works Here SWOB Grant Facility

description.narrative: SME.NG Nigerias Impact Investment Platform has designed the SME.NG Women-Owned Business (SWOB) Grant Facility as a direct response to the adverse impact of COVID-19 on women-owned businesses in Nigeria. The goal of the facility is to provide intervention grants to micro and small businesses that are in survival mode to ensure that they recover from the effects of the pandemic. Based on the findings of survey of carried out by SME.NG, the Federal Ministry for Womens Affairs and NACCIMA, the facility will support these businesses in the core areas they expressed challenges such as replenishing stock, establishing supply chains, paying/retaining staff and exploring new revenue streams. Priority will be given to women entrepreneurs in the agri-business, light manufacturing (PPE) and healthcare sectors.

title.narrative: Kamazou Women Farmers Groundnut Oil Mill Capacity Building Project

description.narrative: Sector: Groundnuts. Beneficiaries: 247 women. Description: KWFCS has been processing groundnuts into oil for years using traditional methods. This project aims to address the Cooperatives constraints by developing its business management, financial management, and technical capacities. The Cooperative will establish a groundnut processing facility, which will use standard groundnut processing machinery capable of producing refined groundnut oil. The Cooperative will hire a business manager, accountant, production and processing supervisor and two marketing staff members. The Cooperative will also undergo a series of trainings aimed at developing the Cooperatives business management, financial management and technical skills. Finally, the Cooperative will engage a consultant to develop a comprehensive five-year business plan that will guide the Cooperative in the near term.

The nearest national grid connection to this community is approximately 40km. The goal of the project is to provide electricity of a rural community of 289 households (approximately 1757 people including 386 men and 670 women).
